remarks: An atomistic lattice with 0 is relatively atomic, using the definition in Remark 2 of [Kalmbach] p. 149.  (Contributed by NM, 21-Oct-2011.) (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
hlrelat5.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
hlrelat5.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
hlrelat5.s $e |- .< = ( lt ` K ) $.
hlrelat5.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
hlrelat5.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
hlrelat5N $p |- ( ( ( K e. HL /\ X e. B /\ Y e. B ) /\ X .< Y ) -> E. p e. A ( X .< ( X .\/ p ) /\ p .<_ Y ) ) $.
$d .<_ p $.
$d A p $.
$d B p $.
$d K p $.
$d X p $.
$d Y p $.
